[Read more ](https://www.chase.com/personal/banking/education/basics/checking-vs-savings-account) [![](https://personal.chase.com/K132-005/images/carousel/educ_different_types.jpg)](https://www.chase.com/personal/banking/education/basics/types-of-savings-accounts) ### The different types of savings accounts, explained [Read more ](https://www.chase.com/personal/banking/education/basics/types-of-savings-accounts) ![updates page content](https://personal.chase.com/K132-005/images/carousel/educ_nav_right_on.svg) * 1 * 2 * 3 * 4 * 5 * 6 ## FAQs ### Learn more about your Chase savings account by reading our frequently asked questions: ## What savings accounts does Chase offer? Our savings accounts have different features that may help you determine which account is best for you. With features like automatic transfers and no monthly service fees with qualifying activities on our savings options, you can help build your savings with a Chase savings account.​ * The Chase SavingsSM account provides easy access to your funds via the Chase Mobile app. * The Chase Premier

for you. With features like automatic transfers and no monthly service fees with qualifying activities on our savings options, you can help build your savings with a Chase savings account.​ * The Chase SavingsSM account provides easy access to your funds via the Chase Mobile app. * The Chase Premier SavingsSM account may let you earn better interest rates on higher balances. ## How do I use a savings account? To start, deposit money into your account by direct deposit, cash, or electronic transfers, but consider setting up automatic transfers from your checking account to help you save consistently. You can access your funds when needed, while earning interest on your balance, making it a smart way to save for future goals, [emergencies](https://www.chase.com/personal/banking/education/budgeting-saving/how-much-should-i-have-in-emergency-fund), or [unexpected expenses](https://www.chase.com/personal/banking/education/basics/common-types-of-unexpected-expenses). ## How to choose a Chase savings account? Before selecting a Chase savings account, figuring out your financial goals and how you plan to use your savings may be a helpful first step. Start by evaluating and [comparing our savings options](https://personal.chase.com/personal/savings) to open the one that aligns best with your needs. Other factors to keep in mind when comparing accounts are minimum balance requirements, monthly fees, and access to online banking tools, which can help you manage your savings effectively and increase your earning potential. ## How can I open a savings account online? You'll need to provide personal information, such as your address, email, Social Security Number and contact details. Once your application is approved, you can fund your new savings account and

help you manage your savings effectively and increase your earning potential. ## How can I open a savings account online? You'll need to provide personal information, such as your address, email, Social Security Number and contact details. Once your application is approved, you can fund your new savings account and help build your savings! **Other miscellaneous fees apply:** See [Additional Banking Services & Fees (PDF)](https://www.chase.com/digital/disclosures-and-interest-rates-personal) for more information. [Same page link returns to footnote reference4](javascript:void\(0\);)Savings-account interest is compounded and credited monthly, based on the daily collected balance. Interest rates are variable and determined daily at Chase's discretion and are subject to change without notice. Balance tiers are applicable as of the effective date of these rates and may change at Chase's discretion. Account fees could reduce earnings. CD interest is fixed for the duration of the term and is compounded daily. [Same page link returns to footnote reference5](javascript:void\(0\);)For Chase Premier SavingsSM: Earn Premier relationship rates when you link the account to a Chase

of these rates and may change at Chase's discretion. Account fees could reduce earnings. CD interest is fixed for the duration of the term and is compounded daily. [Same page link returns to footnote reference5](javascript:void\(0\);)For Chase Premier SavingsSM: Earn Premier relationship rates when you link the account to a Chase Premier Plus CheckingSM or Chase Sapphire® Checking account, and make at least five customer-initiated transactions in a monthly statement period using your linked checking account. [See interest rates](https://www.chase.com/personal/savings/interest-savings/interest-rates). **Savings Text Message Program:** Message and data rates may apply. For Help call 1-800-935-9935. Reply STOP to 33172 to no longer receive Chase SavingsSM text messages until you provide your consent again. Mobile carriers not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. [Same page link returns to footnote reference6](javascript:void\(0\);)There is no Chase fee at non-Chase ATMs. Chase will refund ATM Surcharge Fees charged by the ATM owner/network. This benefit will begin the next business day after opening the account. Some ATM owners/networks do not identify these Surcharge Fees in the information they send to us and, as a result, we may not automatically refund the fee. If for any reason the refund is not processed, please contact us. There is no Foreign Exchange Rate Adjustment Fee when conducting transactions in a foreign currency. If you choose to convert an international transaction to U.S. dollars at either an ATM or on a purchase, foreign currency commissions and fees included in the exchange rate charged by third parties are excluded from Chase Surcharge Fee reimbursements.

Rate Adjustment Fee when conducting transactions in a foreign currency. If you choose to convert an international transaction to U.S. dollars at either an ATM or on a purchase, foreign currency commissions and fees included in the exchange rate charged by third parties are excluded from Chase Surcharge Fee reimbursements. The "No Chase Fee" benefit applies based on your account having this benefit when the debit card or ATM transaction is posted on the account.
